intro: Psedera hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy psedera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
